someone who does not have an infection or fault in their genes (= parts of the DNA in cells that are passed on from their parents) that causes a disease: We compared the risk of disease in carriers to that in noncarriers. The incidence of cancer among non-carriers of the faulty gene was very low.
More examplesFewer examplesThey compared the incidence of cancer between family members who carried the mutation and noncarriers.Younger non-carriers should not need to have annual screening.Of the 269 cases examined, 35% were carriers of the gene and 65% were noncarriers.Two of the patients were carriers and nine were non-carriers.
